{{Infobox comedian | name = Bridget Everett | image = Bridget Everett at La Mama Theater June 9 2012 (cropped).png | alt = | caption = Everett performing at [[La Mama Theatre (Melbourne)|La Mama Theatre]] in 2012 | birth_name = Bridget Jean Everett | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1972|04|21}} | birth_place = [[Manhattan, Kansas|Manhattan]], [[Kansas]] | medium = cabaret, film, music, podcast, stand-up, storytelling, television | nationality = | education = | alma_mater = | active = 2007-present | employer = | genre = comedy | subject = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | notable_work = ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]''
''[[Lady Dynamite]]''
''[[List of original programs distributed by Amazon|Love You More]]''
''[[Patti Cake$]]'' | memorials = | signature = | website = {{URL|bridgeteverett.net}} | footnotes = | module = }} '''Bridget Everett''' (born April 21, 1972){{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/JoesPub/status/590548354960117760|title=Joe's Pub on Twitter|website=Twitter|access-date=2016-05-27}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/news/alt-cabaret-provocateur-bridget-everett-is-the-most-exciting-performer-in-new-york-city-6659332|title=Alt-Cabaret Provocateur Bridget Everett Is the Most Exciting Performer in New York City|last=Seabaugh|first=Julie|date=2014-09-09|website=Village Voice|access-date=2016-05-27}} is an American comedian, actress, singer, writer, and cabaret performer. She has performed stand-up on ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]''{{cite web|title=IMDb|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3008608/|accessdate=11 November 2014}} on [[Comedy Central]]. Everett has described herself as an “alt-cabaret provocateur.”{{cite web|title=Bridget Everett: No Boundaries, No Filter, Lots of Touching|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngbtF8KQ34w|website=YouTube|publisher=Fusion|accessdate=28 December 2014}} ==Early life== Originally from [[Manhattan, Kansas|Manhattan]], [[Kansas]],{{cite web|last1=Isherwood|first1=Charles|title=A friendly face with a foul mouth that sings|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/01/26/theater/reviews/26pink.html|website=NY Times|accessdate=11 November 2014|date=26 January 2007}} she has been performing in New York City for over a decade. Per Everett on the podcast ''Amy Schumer Presents: 3 Girls, 1 Keith'' (episode 2: "Moms and Stuff"): “I’m from Manhattan, Kansas- the little apple. And my dad was mayor at one point, and then so was my brother many years later. So we’re kinda like the Kennedy’s of Manhattan, Kansas." Everett attended college at [[Arizona State University]] on a full scholarship to study music and opera. She worked in the restaurant business for 25 years before she was finally able to quit around the beginning of 2015.{{cite web|title=Bridget Everett Chats About "Fun Mom Dinner"|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PyqLaHgSYuc|website=YouTube.com|accessdate=25 July 2018|date=1 August 2017}} ==Career== Everett met [[Amy Schumer]] at the [[Just for Laughs]] comedy festival in 2009.{{cite web|title=Bridget Everett: Amy Schumer changed my life Larry King Now Ora.TV|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXN1xNnMAns|website=[[YouTube]].com|accessdate=13 July 2018}} Everett has been regularly opening for Schumer on her comedy tours since 2012{{cite web|title=Bridget Everett On Inside Amy Schumer and HBO Canada, Singing "T*****s"|url=http://thecomicscomic.com/2013/07/03/bridget-everett-on-inside-amy-schumer-and-hbo-canada-singing-ts/|website=thecomicscomic.com|accessdate=13 July 2018}} to present. Everett has even upstaged Schumer, then leading Schumer to want to have Everett close for her instead, according to Schumer on her new podcast.{{cite web|title=Amy Schumer Presents: 3 Girls, 1 Keith|url=https://open.spotify.com/show/2UtdM2mvBQesTqGTyiKn8w|website=[[Spotify]].com|accessdate=13 July 2018}} Everett often performs with her band, The Tender Moments, which includes Adam “[[Ad-Rock]]” Horovitz from the [[Beastie Boys]] and Carmine Covelli from [[The Julie Ruin]]. In October 2013, Everett and Horovitz performed in a show called ''Rock Bottom'' that the two co-wrote with ''[[Hairspray (musical)|Hairspray]]'' songwriters [[Marc Shaiman]] and [[Scott Wittman]].{{cite web|last1=Langmuir|first1=Molly|title=129 minutes with Bridget Everett|url=http://nymag.com/news/intelligencer/encounter/bridget-everett-2013-12/|website=New York Magazine|accessdate=11 November 2014|date=24 November 2013}} ''Rock Bottom'' won Everett the 2015 [[Obie Award]]s Special Citation presented by the [[American Theatre Wing]].Obie Awards, [http://www.obieawards.com/2015/05/2015-obie-award-winners-announced/ 2015 Winners]. Bridget has also performed with [[Brad Williams (comedian)|Brad Williams]] in a show called ''Down n Dirty'' (hosted by ''[[Broad City]]''{{’}}s [[Abbi Jacobson]] and [[Ilana Glazer]]) at the [[2014 Bonnaroo Music Festival]]. Bridget performed a duet of ''[[Me and Bobby McGee]]'' with [[Patti LuPone]] at [[Carnegie Hall]]. In 2013, Bridget Everett and the Tender Moments released an album with twelve tracks entitled ''Pound It!'' Everett's first one-hour TV special, ''Bridget Everett: Gynecological Wonder'', premiered on [[Comedy Central]] in 2015. In it, she performs her usual brand of comedy cabaret. On August 1, 2017 Everett got a standing ovation for her ''[[Piece of My Heart]]'' karaoke performance{{Citation|last=The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon|title=Bridget Everett Gets a Standing Ovation for Her "Piece of My Heart" Karaoke Performance|date=2017-08-02|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K8Ab-PuF1DY&feature=youtu.be|accessdate=2017-08-03}} on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]''. On January 3, 2018 ''The Tonight Show'' aired a repeat of Everett performing ''Piece of My Heart''. ==Discography== All releases are with The Tender Moments and all formats are download and streaming. ===Albums=== * 2013: ''Pound It'' (Beavertails Music) * 2015: ''Gynecological Wonder'' ([[Comedy Partners]]) ===Singles=== * 2013: ''Titties'' * 2013: ''What I Gotta Do? (Dirty Version)'' * 2016: ''Eat It'' * 2017: ''Pussy Grabs Back'' (All proceeds go to [[Planned Parenthood]], download only.){{cite web|title=Bridget Everett - Online Store|url=https://bridgeteverett1.fanfire.com/cgi-bin/WebObjects/Store.woa/wa/product?sourceCode=BEVWEB&sku=BEVDD001|website=bridgeteverett1.fanfire.com|accessdate=13 July 2018}} ===Home Videos=== * 2015: ''Gynecological Wonder'' ([[Comedy Central]]) ===Collaborations=== * 2014: [[Neal Medlyn|Champagne Jerry]]: ''For Real, You Guys'' - 3 songs: ''More Wet'', ''Aspirbations Skit'' (feat. Adam Horovitz & Bridget Everett) & ''Just Woke Up'' (vocals) * 2015: [[The Dan Band]]: ''The Wedding Album'' - song: ''Making Love Forever'' (vocals and songwriter) * 2016: Champagne Jerry: ''The Champagne Room'' - song: ''One Talent'' (feat. Bridget Everett, [[Murray Hill (performer)|Murray Hill]], [[Erin Markey]], Larry Krone, Jim Andralis & the Champagne Club) (vocals) * 2016: Jim Andralis & Bridget Everett: ''Hit the Ground Fuckin''' - Single (backing vocals) ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !
